title: Ewan McGregor's Star Wars return as Obi-Wan Kenobi 'long time coming'
text:
Ewan McGregor admitted that his return as Obi-Wan Kenobi has been a ‘long time coming’ (Picture: Lucasfilm/METRO)

Ewan McGregor’s much-touted return as Obi-Wan Kenobi is finally happening and the actor himself has admitted it’s been a ‘long time coming.’

The Scottish star will portray the Jedi Master for the first time since the Star Wars prequel trilogy concluded in 2005 in the new spin-off that is set to debut on Disney+.

His return to the iconic role was first announced at the Disney D23 Expo to much fan-fare. Rumours of a return for Kenobi had been circling for years prior.

And speaking on Lorraine, McGregor seemed relieved that the secret was finally out.

The last tie we saw Kenobi was in 2005’s Revenge of the Sith (Picture: Rex)

‘It’s been a long time coming,’ he said. ‘I feel like I’ve been touting for the part – “remember me? I’m over here!”‘

The Doctor Sleep actor also opened up on growing into the role of Kenobi, who was of course played by the indomitable Sir Alec Guiness in the original film trilogy.

‘What was most satisfying to me about playing Obi-Wan was trying to make him a young Alec Guiness,’ the star explained. ‘Trying to guess how he would play the part when he was my age.’

The new series will fin the gaps in Kenobi’s life btween Revenge of the Sith and A New Hope (Picture: Rex)

McGregor first took on the role in the first of the Star Wars prequels, The Phantom Menace, in 1999. He last made a voice-only cameo in 2015’s The Force Awakens.

‘I was in my 20s, so it was a long while ago,’ the actor continued. ‘Now I’m much closer in age to Alec when he played [Obi-Wan]. Not too close…but I’m getting there!’

The new spin-off will fill fans in on Kenobi’s exploits between the end of Revenge of the Sith and his re-appearance in A New Hope.

The arrival of an Obi-Wan Kenobi spin-off is hot on the heels of the first Star Wars spin-off to hit Disney+, The Mandalorian.

The inaugural show for Disney’s new streaming service will arrive on 12 November and its first episode of the show will include a major spoiler for the Star Wars Universe.

McGregor’s newest film, Doctor Sleep, will be hitting cinemas on 31 October, with rave reviews as the best Stephen King adaption since The Shawshank Redemption.
